docs.text: ultra low budget but extremely inventive horror film about a group of friends vacationing in a cabin who accidentally awaken an evil force in the woods via the necronomicon , the book of the dead .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bruce campbell stars as ash , who eventually becomes the sole survivor and has to battle both the demons from the woods , and his friends who have become demons ( including his own girlfriend ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the results shown on screen are amazing considering the film's tiny budget , constant location changes , and a filming schedule that was sporadic over two years .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: followed by two sequels : evil dead ii ( 1987 ) and army of darkness ( 1993 ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the dvd release of this film from elite entertainment contains the film in it's original aspect ratio of 1 . 33 : 1 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the disc contains two versions of the film's audio : a stereo 2 . 0 track and a newly remastered dolby digital 5 . 1 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: included are two separate running commentary tracks : the first features writer/director sam raimi and producer rob tapert and the second track features the film's star , bruce campbell .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: campbell's commentary is informative and extremely witty , as he has a story to tell for virtually every scene in the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: such informative tidbits include : the original title of the film was going to be book of the dead ( and in fact when the film premiered in 1981 that was it's title ) and when they were asked to change the title to the evil dead , everyone thought it was the worst title they had ever heard .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , there's a scene early on in the film where the group sits around and listens to a tape recorder which they've found that's explaining about the demonic forces in the woods .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for that scene , it was written for the characters to be smoking marijuana , so being the wacky kids that they were at the time , they decided to actually smoke marijuana for the scene .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: almost all of that footage became unusable because many of the actor's had never smoked before , and as a result they became " confused " and were unable to perform the scene .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i wish the entertainment factor was as high for the sam raimi/rob tapert audio track .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the two people you'd think would be more enthusiastic in talking about this film instead barely have much to say at all .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: don't get me wrong here , when they do speak it's entertaining to hear , but there are many instances where both are silent for long periods of time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sometimes after one of those long silences rob will ask " have anything to say sam ? "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to me , that's not a good sign .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , it seems like sam raimi doesn't remember much about the film and it's production . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: well , compared to rob and bruce anyway .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also included on the disc is a photo gallery ( which includes pictures from the film's " gala " premiere ) and about twenty minutes of raw footage from the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this raw footage really shows you how much a film can be improved upon using simple audio techniques .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: overall , the evil dead is a good low budget horror film , superior to many films in it's genre .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and the collector's edition dvd release is well worth your time if you're either a fan of the film or just a fan of the filmmaking process .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: all special edition dvds should be this thorough and entertaining .
docs.label: positive
